section.title: The Solution
section.para: The solution is called Capabilities. Instead of mapping user ID 0 to the super user, and letting that user do all the fun stuff, the idea is to map this into a set of capabilities, like kernel::set_user_id, vfs::adopt_file, ipv4::bind_low_port, and so on. This list of capabilities is not hard-wired into the kernel, but is an extensible list of strings so it is easy to add a new capability that we need without having to recompile (and restart) the kernel.

For compatibility with legacy (GNU and other Unix) systems, we will also have a kernel::super_user capability that is set on a certain user. That capability is the root of other capabilities and thus, a user with the kernel::super_user capability will automatically inherit all other capabilities as well.
